com.esri.mo2.map.dpy
Interface DatasetLayer

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable, Layer, Searchable
All Known Subinterfaces:
FeatureLayer, ImageLayer, ImageServerLayer
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseDatasetLayer, BaseFeatureLayer, BaseImageLayer, BaseImageServerLayer
public interface DatasetLayer
extends Layer, Searchable

A DatasetLayer is a visual representation of a particular MapDataset. When a DatasetLayer is asked to draw itself, it obtains the necessary data from the MapDataset, then passes this to the Renderer.

You can choose to have a DatasetLayer show MapTips by simply setting an appropriate Field using setMapTip(). You can stop MapTips by setting the MapTip Field to null;

See Also:
Map, Layerset, MapDataset

Method Detail

getDataset

public MapDataset getDataset()
Returns the Dataset connected with this layer.

Returns:
the Dataset

setDataset

public void setDataset(MapDataset dset)
Sets the given Dataset to this layer.

Parameters:
dset - the Dataset

isOpaque

public boolean isOpaque()
Determines if the Data shown in this Layer is expected to be opaque or not.

Returns:
a boolean value - True == opaque, else False == otherwise

fetch

public void fetch(Envelope extent,
                  double scale,
                  int width,
                  int height)
this method is called by the DisplayManager whenever the map extent has changed, typically when the setExtent() method has been called in the Map. The DatasetLayer is expected to do whatever necessary to prepare for this change, for example by fetching new data, or updating spatial indexes. The DisplayManager will subsequently call draw() when rendering becomes necessary. Usually a DatasetLayer will delegate fetch to the associated MapDataset.

Parameters:
extent - the new extent of the Display
scale - the new map scale in mapunits/pixel
width - the new map size in pixels across
height - the new map size in pixels down
See Also:
search(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope, com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Fields), MapDataset.fetch(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope, double, int, int)

search

public Cursor search(Envelope qe,
                     Fields qf)
Searches for data in the given Envelope, using a SpatialQuery (which means no new data is retrieved from a Caching Dataset).

Parameters:
qe - the query envelope, which will be clipped to the layer's dataset extent
qf - the Fields to be retrieved, or null == retrieve all Fields
Returns:
the resulting Cursor, null == no data found

createSpatialSearchFilter

public BaseSpatialFilter createSpatialSearchFilter(FeatureGeometry geometry,
                                                   Fields fields)
Creates a SpatialFilter suitable for querying the Layer for the given selection geometry and fields. The "spatial relationship" is set to AREA_INTERSECTION. You can change both geometry and relation type after creating the filter.

Parameters:
geometry - the selection geometry
fields - the query fields, or null == get all the Fields from the Dataset (providing the Dataset is of type Table)
See Also:
search(com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Envelope,com.esri.mo2.data.feat.Fields), SpatialFilter.AREA_INTERSECTION
